body:
Comment 2: 
/dev/null is a concept than spans systems, with different names
on different systems (NUL on Windows).  Many programs
legitimately use /dev/null as an input or output source, especially
when started by other programs.  It is perfectly appropriate
to open /dev/null in polite company.

/dev/tty is not such a concept.  It is inherently Unix-specific.
Opening /dev/tty is, in contrast to /dev/null, almost never
appropriate.

Russ
